alert.note: Alert for Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:21PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Winston County through 345 PM CDT... At 320 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ashridge, or 7 miles southeast of Haleyville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lynn, Double Springs, Houston Recreational Area, Ashbank, Winston Free State Barn, Ashridge, Poplar Springs, Smith Lake, Natural Bridge, Weiss, Clear Creek, Pebble, Delmar, Sipsey River Rec Area and Grayson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
